Interface GameState

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
GameState.BoardInfo, GameState.BoardSquareInfo, GameState.PlayerInfo, GameState.PlayerListInfo
public interface GameState extends Serializable
Marker interface for all serializable data structures representing the state of various elements in the game.

Implementations of this interface are immutable data carriers designed to be transmitted between the server and connected clients as part of the game's state synchronization mechanism.

The nested record types provide structured representations of:

  • the game board and its metadata,
  • individual board squares,
  • the list of players and the information about the currently active one,
  • the attributes of a single player,
  • utility structures describing positions and lightweight player descriptors.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static final record 
    GameState.BoardInfo
    Immutable descriptor of global board metadata.
    static final record 
    GameState.BoardSquareInfo
    Information about a single square on the game board.
    static enum 
    GameState.Pack
    Specifies which part of the game state is being updated.
    static final record 
    GameState.PlayerDesc
    Lightweight player descriptor used for board-level views (e.g., showing each player's location on the board).
    static final record 
    GameState.PlayerInfo
    Full information about a single player, suitable for rendering the player's panel or status data.
    static final record 
    GameState.PlayerListInfo
    Contains the list of players participating in the game along with the index of the currently active player.
    static final record 
    GameState.Position
    Represents a column/row position on the game board.
